intro: Tetratheca ciliata var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are smooth and often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the cooler months. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry environments. This variety is distinguished by its lack of hairy structures on the leaves, giving it a smooth appearance.
